page.title: 04Lydney R.F.C.
page.content: Whereever the name of Lydney is mentioned the conversation will probably turn to rugby.For a town with about eight thousand inhabitants Lydney's record in recent seasons is remarkable.The club has reached the third round of the John Player Cup regularly and this year lost only to Sale,the leading English club in the fourth round.Five internationals in recent times also gives local pride. The club normally fields three senior fifteens,a Colts team and a number of junior mini-rugby sides. In 1987 Lydney will celebrate its centenary.Preparations are already in hand for special matches against top sides to supplement the already strong fixture list.With its excellent facilities and great enthusiasm the second hundred years should be as successful as the first.
